page.title: 09Footpaths in Stambourne
page.content: Many public footpaths are shown on the Ordnance Survey map in the Stambourne and Toppesfield area. We went out to look for them but a lot were not there because nobody has walked on them for many years. Those we found were marked at each end by a concrete "Public Footpath" sign but it was sometimes difficult to find exactly where they went.Some paths are ploughed up and hedges which may once have bordered paths have occasionally been removed.Footpaths near to the centre of the villages are regularly used by local residents, especially people out exercising their dogs.A group of people in Toppesfield have formed a society to preserve footpaths.They have identified several little-used footpaths and have walked them to confirm their existence.
